description: Google Docs is a cloud-based word processor with real-time collaboration, version history, and integration with other Google Workspace apps

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_COPY_DOCUMENT
tools.description: Tool to create a copy of an existing Google Document. Use this to duplicate a document, for example, when using an existing document as a template. The copied document will have a default title (e.g., 'Copy of [original title]') if no new title is provided, and will be placed in the user's root Google Drive folder.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new copied document. If not provided, the title will be 'Copy of [original document's title]'.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the Google Document to be copied.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_DOCUMENT
tools.description: Creates a new Google Docs document using the provided title as filename and inserts the initial text at the beginning if non-empty, returning the document's ID and metadata (excluding body content).

text.title: Text
examples: This document outlines the key findings...
text.description: Initial text content to insert at the beginning of the new document.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title for the new document, used as its filename in Google Drive.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_DOCUMENT_MARKDOWN
tools.description: Creates a new Google Docs document, optionally initializing it with a title and content provided as Markdown text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new Google Docs document.

markdown_text.title: Markdown Text
markdown_text.description: The initial content for the document, formatted as Markdown. Supports various Markdown elements including headings, lists (nested lists are not supported), tables, images (via publicly accessible URLs), blockquotes, code blocks, and text formatting (bold, italic, etc.). If an empty string is provided, the document will be created with only the title. Image URL constraints: URLs must be less than or equal to 2KB in length. Supported image formats: JPEG, PNG, GIF (SVG is not supported).

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_FOOTER
tools.description: Tool to create a new footer in a Google Document. Use when you need to add a footer, optionally specifying its type and the section it applies to.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of footer to create.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to create the footer in.

section_break_location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

section_break_location.description: The location of the SectionBreak immediately preceding the section whose SectionStyle this footer should belong to. If this is unset or refers to the first section break in the document, the footer applies to the document style.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_FOOTNOTE
tools.description: Tool to create a new footnote in a Google Document. Use this when you need to add a footnote at a specific location or at the end of the document body.

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The index is relative to the beginning of the segment specified by segment_id.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

location.description: Inserts the footnote reference at a specific index in the document. The segmentId within this Location object must be empty as footnotes can only be inserted in the document body.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to create the footnote in.

endOfSegmentLocation.title: EndOfSegmentLocation

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

endOfSegmentLocation.description: Inserts the footnote reference at the end of the document body. The segmentId within this EndOfSegmentLocation object must be empty.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_HEADER
tools.description: Tool to create a new header in a Google Document. Use this tool when you need to add a header to a document, optionally specifying the section it applies to.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to create the header in.

createHeader.title: Create Header

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of header to create.

sectionBreakLocation.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

sectionBreakLocation.description: The location of the SectionBreak which begins the section this header should belong to.

createHeader.description: The details of the header to create.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_NAMED_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to create a new named range in a Google Document. Use this to assign a name to a specific part of the document for easier reference or programmatic manipulation.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new named range. Must be 1-256 characters.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document where the named range will be created.

rangeEndIndex.title: Range End Index
rangeEndIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range.

rangeSegmentId.title: Range Segment Id
rangeSegmentId.description: Optional. The ID of the header, footer, or footnote. Empty for document body.

rangeStartIndex.title: Range Start Index
rangeStartIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_CREATE_PARAGRAPH_BULLETS
tools.description: Tool to add bullets to paragraphs within a specified range in a Google Document. Use when you need to format a list or a set of paragraphs as bullet points.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

range.title: Range

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, exclusive.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote that this range is contained in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, inclusive.

range.description: The range to apply the bullet preset to.

bulletPreset.title: Bullet Preset
bulletPreset.description: The kinds of bullet glyphs to be used.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_CONTENT_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to delete a range of content from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a specific portion of text or other structural elements within a document.

range.title: Range

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab. In a document with a single tab, if provided, it must match the singular tab's ID; if omitted, it applies to the singular tab. In a multi-tab document, if provided, it applies to the specified tab; if omitted, it applies to the first tab.

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote the range is in. An empty segment ID or omitting this field signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

range.description: The range of content to delete. Deleting text across paragraph boundaries may merge paragraphs and affect styles. Certain deletions can invalidate document structure (e.g., part of a surrogate pair, last newline of critical elements, incomplete deletion of tables/equations).

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document from which to delete content. This ID can be found in the URL of the Google Doc.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_FOOTER
tools.description: Tool to delete a footer from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a footer from a specific section or the default footer.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The tab that contains the footer to delete. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

footer_id.title: Footer Id
footer_id.description: The ID of the footer to delete. If this footer is defined on DocumentStyle, the reference to this footer is removed, resulting in no footer of that type for the first section of the document. If this footer is defined on a SectionStyle, the reference to this footer is removed and the footer of that type is now continued from the previous section.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to delete the footer from.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_HEADER
tools.description: Deletes the header from the specified section or the default header if no section is specified. Use this tool to remove a header from a Google Document.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The tab containing the header to delete. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

header_id.title: Header Id
header_id.description: The ID of the header to delete. If this header is defined on `DocumentStyle`, the reference to this header is removed, resulting in no header of that type for the first section of the document. If this header is defined on a `SectionStyle`, the reference to this header is removed and the header of that type is now continued from the previous section.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document from which to delete the header.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_NAMED_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to delete a named range from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a previously defined named range by its ID or name.

deleteNamedRange.title: Delete Named Range

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the range(s) to delete. All named ranges with the given name will be deleted.

namedRangeId.title: Named Range Id
namedRangeId.description: The ID of the named range to delete.

tabsCriteria.title: TabsCriteria

tabIds.title: Tab Ids
tabIds.description: The list of tab IDs in which the request executes.

tabsCriteria.description: Optional. The criteria used to specify which tab(s) the range deletion should occur in. When omitted, the range deletion is applied to all tabs.

deleteNamedRange.description: Specifies the named range to delete.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_PARAGRAPH_BULLETS
tools.description: Tool to remove bullets from paragraphs within a specified range in a Google Document. Use when you need to clear bullet formatting from a section of a document.

range.title: Range

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. If omitted, it applies to the first tab or the singular tab in a single-tab document.

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the start of the segment.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote the range is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the start of the segment.

range.description: The range of the document from which to delete paragraph bullets. The range is applied to the document body by default. To specify a different segment (e.g. header, footer), include segment_id in the range object.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. If omitted, it applies to the first tab or the singular tab in a single-tab document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_TABLE
tools.description: Tool to delete an entire table from a Google Document. Use when you have the document ID and the specific start and end index of the table element to be removed. The table's range can be found by inspecting the document's content structure.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The ID of the tab containing the table, if the document uses tabs. If omitted, the action applies to the first tab or the only tab.

segment_id.title: Segment Id
segment_id.description: The ID of the segment (e.g., header, footer) containing the table. If omitted or empty, the table is assumed to be in the main document body.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the Google Document from which the table will be deleted.

table_end_index.title: Table End Index
table_end_index.description: The end index (UTF-16 code unit) of the table's range to be deleted.

table_start_index.title: Table Start Index
table_start_index.description: The start index (UTF-16 code unit) of the table's range to be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_TABLE_COLUMN
tools.description: Tool to delete a column from a table in a Google Document. Use this tool when you need to remove a specific column from an existing table within a document.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index. For example, the second row in the table has a row index of 1.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index. For example, the second column in the table has a column index of 1.

tableStartLocation.title: Table Start Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which the column will be deleted.

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: A list of requests to be applied to the document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to delete the table column from.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_DELETE_TABLE_ROW
tools.description: Tool to delete a row from a table in a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a specific row from an existing table.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index. For example, the second row in the table has a row index of 1.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index. For example, the second column in the table has a column index of 1.

tableStartLocation.title: Table Start Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The index is relative to the beginning of the segment specified by segment_id.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which the row will be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_GET_CHARTS_FROM_SPREADSHEET
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of all charts from a specified Google Sheets spreadsheet. Use when you need to get chart IDs and their specifications for embedding or referencing elsewhere, such as in Google Docs.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the Google Sheets spreadsheet from which to retrieve charts.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_GET_DOCUMENT_BY_ID
tools.description: Retrieves an existing Google Document by its ID; will error if the document is not found.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier for the Google Document to be retrieved. This action specifically fetches an existing document and will not create a new one if the ID is not found. You can fetch the documents using GOOGLEDOCS_SEARCH_DOCUMENTS action

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_INSERT_INLINE_IMAGE
tools.description: Tool to insert an image from a given URI at a specified location in a Google Document as an inline image. Use when you need to add an image to a document programmatically.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: The URI of the image. Must be a publicly accessible direct image URL (no redirects or viewer links like Google Drive preview pages). Images must be less than 50MB, not exceed 25 megapixels, and be in PNG, JPEG, or GIF format (SVG not supported). The URI can be at most 2 kB in length.

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index within the segment where the image will be inserted (required). Use 1 to insert at the beginning of the document body, or a higher number to insert at a specific position.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the image will be inserted. If not provided, the image is inserted in the document body.

location.description: The location in the document to insert the image. The index field is required to specify the insertion point.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

objectSize.title: ObjectSize

unit.title: UnitEnum
unit.description: The units for magnitude. Supported units: EMU, PT (PX is not supported by the API).

unit.title: UnitEnum
unit.description: The units for magnitude. Supported units: EMU, PT (PX is not supported by the API).

objectSize.description: The size of the image. If not specified, the image is rendered at its intrinsic size.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_INSERT_PAGE_BREAK
tools.description: Tool to insert a page break into a Google Document. Use when you need to start new content on a fresh page, such as at the end of a chapter or section.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

insertPageBreak.title: Insert Page Break

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The page break is inserted before this index.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the page break is to be inserted. For page breaks, this should typically be null or empty, indicating the main document body, as page breaks are not allowed in headers, footers, or footnotes.

location.description: Specifies the location to insert the page break using a zero-based index. Use this or end_of_segment_location.

endOfSegmentLocation.title: EndOfSegmentLocation

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the page break is to be inserted. For page breaks, this must be null or an empty string, indicating the end of the main document body.

endOfSegmentLocation.description: Specifies that the page break should be inserted at the end of a segment (document body). Use this or location.

insertPageBreak.description: The details for the insertPageBreak request.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_INSERT_TABLE_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to insert a table into a Google Document. Use when you need to add a new table at a specific location or at the end of a segment (like document body, header, or footer) in a document.

rows.title: Rows
rows.description: The number of rows in the table.

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index where the table will be inserted. If provided, 'location' will be used. If omitted and 'insertAtEndOfSegment' is false or omitted, 'endOfSegmentLocation' will be used for the document body.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: The number of columns in the table.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

insertAtEndOfSegment.title: Insert At End Of Segment
insertAtEndOfSegment.description: If true, inserts the table at the end of the segment (document body, header, or footer specified by segment_id). If false or omitted, and 'index' is not provided, it defaults to inserting at the end of the document body. If 'index' is provided, this field is ignored.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_INSERT_TABLE_COLUMN
tools.description: Tool to insert a new column into a table in a Google Document. Use this tool when you need to add a column to an existing table at a specific location.

insertRight.title: Insert Right
insertRight.description: Whether to insert new column to the right of the reference cell location. True: insert to the right. False: insert to the left.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index of the reference cell.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index of the reference cell.

tableStartLocation.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which columns will be inserted.

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: A list of requests to be applied to the document. For this action, it will contain one InsertTableColumnRequest.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_INSERT_TEXT_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to insert a string of text at a specified location within a Google Document. Use when you need to add new text content to an existing document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to insert text into.

text_to_insert.title: Text To Insert
text_to_insert.description: The string of text to insert.

insertion_index.title: Insertion Index
insertion_index.description: The EOL character of the paragraph will be moved to the end of the inserted text. The index where the text will be inserted. The index is zero-based and refers to the UTF-16 code unit. For example, to insert text at the beginning of the document, use an index of 1 (to account for the first paragraph).

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_LIST_SPREADSHEET_CHARTS_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of charts with their IDs and metadata from a Google Sheets spreadsheet. Use to identify charts available for embedding into Google Docs.

fields_mask.title: Fields Mask
fields_mask.description: Field mask to specify which parts of the spreadsheet and chart resources to include. Example: '''sheets(properties(sheetId,title),charts(chartId,spec(title,altText)))'''

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the Google Sheets spreadsheet.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_REPLACE_ALL_TEXT
tools.description: Tool to replace all occurrences of a specified text string with another text string throughout a Google Document. Use when you need to perform a global find and replace operation within a document.

tab_ids.title: Tab Ids
tab_ids.description: Optional. A list of specific tab IDs to perform the replacement on. If not provided, replacement occurs on all tabs.

find_text.title: Find Text
find_text.description: The text to search for in the document.

match_case.title: Match Case
match_case.description: Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

replace_text.title: Replace Text
replace_text.description: The text that will replace the matched text.

search_by_regex.title: Search By Regex
search_by_regex.description: Optional. If True, the find_text is treated as a regular expression. Defaults to False.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_REPLACE_IMAGE
tools.description: Tool to replace a specific image in a document with a new image from a URI. Use when you need to update an existing image within a Google Doc.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document containing the image to replace.

replace_image.title: Replace Image

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: The URI of the new image. The image is fetched once at insertion time and a copy is stored for display inside the document. Images must be less than 50MB in size, cannot exceed 25 megapixels, and must be in one of PNG, JPEG, or GIF format. The provided URI must be publicly accessible and at most 2 kB in length. The URI itself is saved with the image, and exposed via the ImageProperties.content_uri field.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The tab that the image to be replaced is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

image_object_id.title: Image Object Id
image_object_id.description: The ID of the existing image that will be replaced. The ID can be retrieved from the response of a get request.

image_replace_method.title: ImageReplaceMethod
image_replace_method.description: The replacement method. Defaults to CENTER_CROP if not specified.

replace_image.description: The details of the image replacement request.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_SEARCH_DOCUMENTS
tools.description: Search for Google Documents using various filters including name, content, date ranges, and more.

query.title: Query
query.description: Search query to filter documents. Can search by name (name contains 'report'), full text content (fullText contains 'important'), or use complex queries with operators like 'and', 'or', 'not'. Leave empty to get all documents.

order_by.title: Order By
order_by.description: Order results by field. Common options: 'modifiedTime desc', 'modifiedTime asc', 'name', 'createdTime desc'

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of documents to return (1-1000). Defaults to 10.

starred_only.title: Starred Only
starred_only.description: Whether to return only starred documents. Defaults to False.

created_after.title: Created After
created_after.description: Return documents created after this date. Use RFC 3339 format like '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

modified_after.title: Modified After
modified_after.description: Return documents modified after this date. Use RFC 3339 format like '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

shared_with_me.title: Shared With Me
shared_with_me.description: Whether to return only documents shared with the current user. Defaults to False.

include_trashed.title: Include Trashed
include_trashed.description: Whether to include documents in trash. Defaults to False.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UNMERGE_TABLE_CELLS
tools.description: Tool to unmerge previously merged cells in a table. Use this when you need to revert merged cells in a Google Document table back to their individual cell states.

tableRange.title: Table Range

rowSpan.title: Row Span
rowSpan.description: The row span of the table range.

columnSpan.title: Column Span
columnSpan.description: The column span of the table range.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index. For example, the second row in the table has a row index of 1.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index. For example, the second column in the table has a column index of 1.

tableStartLocation.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the table is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The cell location where the table range starts.

tableRange.description: The table range specifying which cells of the table to unmerge.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to unmerge table cells in.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UPDATE_DOCUMENT_MARKDOWN
tools.description: Replaces the entire content of an existing Google Docs document with new Markdown text; requires edit permissions for the document.

inputSchema.title: UpdateDocumentMarkdownRequest

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: Identifier of the Google Docs document to update, found in the document's URL.

new_markdown_text.title: New Markdown Text
examples:
# Document Title

This is a paragraph with **bold** and *italic* text.

- Unordered list item 1
- Unordered list item 2

1. Ordered list item 1
2. Ordered list item 2

An image: ![Alt text for image](https://www.example.com/image.png)

## Advanced Markdown


# Example Python code
def greet(name):
    print(f'Hello, {name}!')
greet('World')


| Column A | Column B |
|----------|----------|
|   Data 1 |   Data 2 |
|   Data 3 |   Data 4 |

> This is a blockquote.
new_markdown_text.description: Markdown content that will replace the document's entire existing content. Supports standard Markdown features.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request schema for updating an existing Google Docs document by replacing its content with new text formatted in Markdown.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UPDATE_DOCUMENT_SECTION_MARKDOWN
tools.description: Tool to insert or replace a section of a Google Docs document with Markdown content. Use when you need to update only a section of a document by specifying start and optional end indices. Supports full Markdown formatting.

end_index.title: End Index
end_index.description: Optional one-based end index of the content to replace; must be greater than or equal to start_index if provided. If end_index is not provided, the content is inserted at the start_index. The index is 1-based to match the Google Docs API.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the Google Docs document to update.

start_index.title: Start Index
start_index.description: One-based UTF-16 code unit index where to insert or start replacement. The index is 1-based to match the Google Docs API.

markdown_text.title: Markdown Text
markdown_text.description: Markdown content to insert or replace in the document section.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UPDATE_DOCUMENT_STYLE
tools.description: Tool to update the overall document style, such as page size, margins, and default text direction. Use when you need to modify the global style settings of a Google Document.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to update. Use '*' to update all fields in document_style. For example: "pageSize,marginTop,marginBottom".

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The ID of the tab to update the style for. If not provided, the first tab is used.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

document_style.title: Document Style

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The size of a page in the document.

marginTop.title: Margin Top
marginTop.description: The top margin of the page.

background.title: Background
background.description: The background of the document. The background fill must be specified as a solid fill with nested OptionalColor schema. Structure: {'color': {'rgbColor': {'red': float, 'green': float, 'blue': float}}}. RGB values should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

marginLeft.title: Margin Left
marginLeft.description: The left margin of the page.

marginRight.title: Margin Right
marginRight.description: The right margin of the page.

marginBottom.title: Margin Bottom
marginBottom.description: The bottom margin of the page.

marginFooter.title: Margin Footer
marginFooter.description: The footer margin of the page (distance from bottom of page to footer content).

marginHeader.title: Margin Header
marginHeader.description: The header margin of the page (distance from top of page to header content).

defaultFooterId.title: Default Footer Id
defaultFooterId.description: The ID of the default footer. If unset, the document inherits the default footer from the parent document. This property is read-only.

defaultHeaderId.title: Default Header Id
defaultHeaderId.description: The ID of the default header. If unset, the document inherits the default header from the parent document. This property is read-only.

oddPageFooterId.title: Odd Page Footer Id
oddPageFooterId.description: The ID of the footer for odd pages. If unset, the document inherits the odd page footer from the parent document. This property is read-only.

oddPageHeaderId.title: Odd Page Header Id
oddPageHeaderId.description: The ID of the header for odd pages. If unset, the document inherits the odd page header from the parent document. This property is read-only.

pageNumberStart.title: Page Number Start
pageNumberStart.description: The page number from which to start counting the number of pages.

evenPageFooterId.title: Even Page Footer Id
evenPageFooterId.description: The ID of the footer for even pages. If unset, the document inherits the even page footer from the parent document. This property is read-only.

evenPageHeaderId.title: Even Page Header Id
evenPageHeaderId.description: The ID of the header for even pages. If unset, the document inherits the even page header from the parent document. This property is read-only.

useEvenPageHeaderFooter.title: Use Even Page Header Footer
useEvenPageHeaderFooter.description: Indicates whether to use the even page header / footer, used in conjunction with use_first_page_header_footer.

useFirstPageHeaderFooter.title: Use First Page Header Footer
useFirstPageHeaderFooter.description: Indicates whether to use the first page header / footer.

document_style.description: The DocumentStyle object with the new style settings.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UPDATE_EXISTING_DOCUMENT
tools.description: Applies programmatic edits, such as text insertion, deletion, or formatting, to a specified Google Doc using the `batchUpdate` API method.

inputSchema.title: DocumentRequest

editDocs.title: Edit Docs

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Docs document to be updated.

inputSchema.description: Request model for updating an existing Google Docs document with specified edit operations.

tools.name: GOOGLEDOCS_UPDATE_TABLE_ROW_STYLE
tools.description: Tool to update the style of a table row in a Google Document. Use when you need to modify the appearance of specific rows within a table, such as setting minimum row height or marking rows as headers.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: The fields that should be updated. At least one field must be specified. The root tableRowStyle is implied and should not be specified. A single "*" can be used as short-hand for listing every field. For example to update the minimum row height, set fields to "minRowHeight".

rowIndices.title: Row Indices
rowIndices.description: The list of zero-based row indices whose style should be updated. If no indices are specified, all rows will be updated.

tableRowStyle.title: Table Row Style

tableHeader.title: Table Header
tableHeader.description: Whether the row is a table header.

minRowHeight.title: Dimension
minRowHeight.description: The minimum height of the row. The row will be rendered in the Docs editor at a height equal to or greater than this value in order to show all the content in the row's cells.

preventOverflow.title: Prevent Overflow
preventOverflow.description: Whether the row cannot overflow across page or column boundaries.

tableRowStyle.description: The styles to be set on the rows.

tableStartLocation.title: Table Start Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.
